---
title: Sulcus Sign
subtitle: Special Test for Inferior Capsular Laxity
---


# Technique

It is performed with the shoulder adducted to the side while axial traction is applied to the arm creating a void under the acromion @johnsonMultidirectionalShoulderInstability2024

# Grading

- A sulcus sign can be present in typical individuals @johnsonMultidirectionalShoulderInstability2024
- A sulcus of >2cm is more severe and likely represents pathologic laxity
    - If the maneuver recreates the patient's sx, this is even more indicative of pathologic laxity @johnsonMultidirectionalShoulderInstability2024

# Interpretation

- Inferior joint laxity
    - Specifically the capsule
